thread.title: US IG CLOSE-Four high-grade issuers raise US$5.25bn
thread.title_full: US IG CLOSE-Four high-grade issuers raise US$5.25bn

title: US IG CLOSE-Four high-grade issuers raise US$5.25bn
text:
+0.22 
By Mike Gambale 
NEW YORK, Oct (HKSE: 3366-OL.HK - news ) 6 (IFR) - Below is a recap of primary issuance activity in the US high-grade market on Tuesday: 
Number of deals priced: 4 
Total (Swiss: FP.SW - news ) issuance volume: US$5.25bn 
Total book to cover: 3.14 
Average NIC: 7 
ROYAL BANK OF CANADA (LSE: 0QKU.L - news ) 
Royal Bank of Canada (RY), Aaa/AAA/AAA, announced a US$ benchmark SEC registered 5-year (10/14/2020) fixed covered bond. The active bookrunners include Citigroup (NYSE: C - news ) , HSBC, Royal Bank of Canada and TD Securities. Guarantor: RBC Covered Bond Guarantor Limited Partnership. Settle: 10/14/2015. 
IPT: MS+75bp area 
PRICE GUIDANCE: MS+72bp (the #) 
LAUNCH: US$1.75bn at MS+72bp 
PRICED: US$1.75bn. Cpn 2.100%. Due 10/14/2020. Ip US$99.967. Yld 2.107%. MS+72bp (T+77.85bp). 
BOOK: Just over US$2bn 
NIC (NasdaqGS: EGOV - news ) : 6bp (vs. 1.875% '20s at MS+61bp, add 5bp for maturity extension, FV=MS+66bp) 
COMPS: 
2.000% October 1, 2018 at MS+55bp (bid) 
1.875% February 5, 2020 at MS+61bp (bid) 
ROLLS ROYCE (LSE: RR.L - news ) 
Rolls-Royce PLC, A3/A, announced a US$ benchmark 144A/RegS 2-part senior unsecured note offering that includes a 5-year (10/14/2020) and 10-year (10/14/2025). The active bookrunners include Bank of America (Swiss: BAC.SW - news ) , Citigroup, Goldman Sachs (NYSE: GS-PB - news ) and JPMorgan. 
The notes include a 1mo par call on the 5yr and 3mo par call on the 10yr. Ranking: Guaranteed by Rolls-Royce Holdings plc. Settle: T+5 (October 14th, 2015). UOP: GCP and to increase liquidity. 
IPTs: 5-year T+137.5bp area, 10-year T+187.5bp area 
PRICE GUIDANCE: 5yr T+110bp area, 10yr T+165bp area. Area is +/- 5bp. 
LAUNCH: US$1.5bn 2-part. US$500m 5yr at T+105bp, US$1bn 10yr at T+160bp. 
PRICED: US$1.5bn 2-part. Settlement date 10/14/2015. 
- US$500m. Cpn 2.375%. Due 10/14/2020 Ip US$99.948. Yld 2.836%. T+105bp. MWC T+20bp. 
- US$1bn. Cpn 3.625%. Due 10/14/2025. Ip US$99.900. Yld 3.637%. T+160bp. MWC T+25bp. 
BOOK: Total US$7.8bn; 5-year US$3.1bn, 10-year US$4.7bn 
NIC: 5-year: Flat (5/10s curve worth 55bp, FV=G+105bp) 
10-year: Flat (vs. SIEGR 3.25% '25s at G+117bp, add 8bp for one-notch rating differential, FV=G+125bp. Add 35bp for market cap differential, FV=G+160bp) 
MARKET CAP: Rolls Royce US$13.12bn, Siemens US$70.78bn 
COMPS: 
SIEGR (A1/A+) 2.150% May 27, 2020 at G+81bp 
SIEGR (A1/A+) 3.250% May 27, 2025 at G+117bp 
LMT (Baa1/A-/A-) 2.900% March 1, 2025 at G+127 
AIRFP A2/A/A-) 2.700% April (LSE: 0N69.L - news ) 17, 2023 at G+135bp 
BALN (Baa2/BBB+/BBB+) 3.800% October 7, 2024 at G+164bp 
NORILSK NICKEL 
Norilsk Nickel, (Ba1/BBB-/BBB-), announced a US$ benchmark 7-year (10/14/2022) senior unsecured loan participation notes via Barclays (LSE: BARC.L - news ) , Citigroup, ING, SocGen (Paris: FR0000130809 - news ) and Unicredit (EUREX: DE000A163206.EX - news ) . Settlement date 10/14/2015. 
IPT: 7% area 
FINAL GUIDANCE: 6.75% (+/-12.5bp) for a US dollar seven-year bond. 
LAUNCH: US$1bn 7-year at 6.625%. 
PRICED: US$1bn. Cpn 6.625%. Due 10/14/2022. Ip par. Yld 6.625%. T+488.9bp. 
BOOK: US$4bn
